original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens at 323.00/85 to the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened at 323.00/85 to the US dollar on Monday, from 325.25/45 on Friday, dealers said.
The Colombo Stock Exchange opened up with the All Share Price Index up 0.08 percent at 10,614, and the S&P SL20 up 0.06 percent at 3,041.
A bond maturing on 01.06.2025 was quoted stable at 13.50/65 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.08.2026 was quoted at 13.75/85 percent down from 13.80/90 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.01.2027 was quoted stable at 13.75/85 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2028 was quoted at 14.10/20 percent up from 14.05/15 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2030 was quoted at 14.00/20 percent, from 14.05/20 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2032 was quoted at 14.10/25 percent, from 14.10/30 percent. (Colombo/Dec27/2023)
